dtconfig.name: bauhaus/scale
dtconfig.shortdescription: widget scale
dtconfig.longdescription: scaling factor for bauhaus widgets, will affect font size

dtconfig.name: database
dtconfig.shortdescription: database location
dtconfig.longdescription: filename relative to ~/.config/darktable or starting with a slash (needs a restart).

dtconfig.name: panel_width
dtconfig.shortdescription: width of the side panels in pixels
dtconfig.longdescription: (needs a restart)

dtconfig.name: cache_memory
dtconfig.shortdescription: memory in bytes to use for mipmap cache
dtconfig.longdescription: (needs a restart)

dtconfig.name: worker_threads
dtconfig.shortdescription: number of background threads
dtconfig.longdescription: this controls for example how many threads are used to create thumbnails during import. the cache will grow to a maximum of twice this number of full resolution image buffers (needs a restart).

dtconfig.name: parallel_export
dtconfig.shortdescription: export multiple images in parallel
dtconfig.longdescription: set this variable to num_threads if you want multithreaded export to process multiple images at a time. be warned: every thread will need about 1GB of memory. setting this to 1 switches on per-image parallelization.

dtconfig.name: host_memory_limit
dtconfig.shortdescription: host memory limit (in MB) for tiling
dtconfig.longdescription: this variable controls the maximum amount of memory (in MB) a module may use during image processing. lower values will force memory hungry modules to process image with increasing number of tiles. setting this to 0 will omit any limit. values below 500 will be treated as 500. needs a restart.

dtconfig.name: singlebuffer_limit
dtconfig.shortdescription: minimum amount of memory (in MB) for a single buffer in tiling
dtconfig.longdescription: if set to a positive, non-zero value this variable defines the minimum amount of memory (in MB) that tiling should take for a single image buffer. has precedence over heuristics based on host_memory_limit. needs a restart.

dtconfig.name: opencl_memory_headroom
dtconfig.shortdescription: amount of opencl memory (in MB) which we assume as being reserved for the driver
dtconfig.longdescription: this amount of memory (in MB) will be substracted from total gpu memory in order to calculate the available opencl memory. too low values will lead to out-of-memory situations in opencl processing. too high values will lead to unnecessary tiling (needs a restart).

dtconfig.name: opencl_avoid_atomics
dtconfig.shortdescription: do not run opencl kernels which require atomic operations
dtconfig.longdescription: if set to TRUE darktable will not use opencl kernels which contain atomic operations (example bilateral). pixelpipe processing will be done on cpu for the affected modules. useful if your opencl implementation freezes/crashes on atomics or if they are processed with a bad performance.

dtconfig.name: opencl_number_event_handles
dtconfig.shortdescription: the number of opencl event handles darktable can use
dtconfig.longdescription: a positive non-zero integer defines the number of event handles that darktable may have opened on a device. a value of -1 does not pose any restrictions, bearing the risk of hitting the device's resource limits. a value of zero completely prevents the use of event handles.

dtconfig.name: opencl_async_pixelpipe
dtconfig.shortdescription: run opencl pixelpipe asynchronously
dtconfig.longdescription: if set to TRUE opencl pixelpipe will not be synchronized on a per-module basis. this can improve pixelpipe latency. however, potential opencl errors would be detected late; in such a case the complete pixelpipe needs to be reprocessed instead of only a single module. export pixelpipe will always be run synchronously.

dtconfig.name: opencl_synch_cache
dtconfig.shortdescription: copy back opencl buffers into pixelpipe cache after each module
dtconfig.longdescription: this brings pixelpipe cache and opencl buffers in synch after each module. on slow GPUs this might improve speed as it avoids reprocessing the whole pixelpipe on every parameter change. on fast GPUs the additional memory transfer overhead will slow down opencl considerably.

dtconfig.name: opencl_micro_nap
dtconfig.shortdescription: pause opencl processing for this number of microseconds from time to time
dtconfig.longdescription: for slow GPUs this gives your graphics driver some time to breathe to do needed screen updates. can be left at zero for fast devices.

dtconfig.name: opencl_device_priority
dtconfig.shortdescription: priority of OpenCL devices for each pixelpipe type
dtconfig.longdescription: defines priorities on how (multiple) OpenCL devices are allocated to the different types of pixelpipe (full, preview, export, thumbnail). for more details visit our usermanual. needs a restart.

dtconfig.name: never_use_embedded_thumb
dtconfig.shortdescription: don't use embedded preview jpeg but half-size raw
dtconfig.longdescription: check this option to not use the embedded jpeg from the raw file but process the raw data. this is slower but gives you color managed thumbnails.

dtconfig.name: write_sidecar_files
dtconfig.shortdescription: write sidecar file for each image
dtconfig.longdescription: these redundant files can later be re-imported into a different database, preserving your changes to the image.

dtconfig.name: opencl
dtconfig.shortdescription: activate opencl support
dtconfig.longdescription: if found, use opencl runtime on your system for improved processing speed. can be switched on and off at any time.

dtconfig.name: opencl_library
dtconfig.shortdescription: system library with opencl runtime
dtconfig.longdescription: opencl runtime library is normally detected automatically by darktable. if your opencl runtime is at an unusual place and cannot be detected, enter the full pathname here. leave empty for default behavior.

dtconfig.name: opencl_memory_requirement
dtconfig.shortdescription: minmum amount of GPU memory (MB) required to activate opencl
dtconfig.longdescription: opencl will only be activated if your graphics card has at least this amount of memory. reducing the value will allow cards with less GPU memory to be used - but at the risk of lower system stability and occasional crashes. values below 200 will be treated as 200.

dtconfig.name: opencl_size_roundup
dtconfig.shortdescription: round opencl work group sizes to a multiple of
dtconfig.longdescription: in opencl processing round width/height of global work groups to a multiple of this value. reasonable values are powers of 2. this parameter can have high impact on opencl performance.

dtconfig.name: ask_before_remove
dtconfig.shortdescription: ask before removing images from database
dtconfig.longdescription: always ask the user before any image is removed from db.

dtconfig.name: ask_before_delete
dtconfig.shortdescription: ask before erasing images from disk
dtconfig.longdescription: always ask the user before any image file is deleted.

dtconfig.name: ask_before_move
dtconfig.shortdescription: ask before moving images from film roll folder
dtconfig.longdescription: always ask the user before any image file is moved.

dtconfig.name: ask_before_copy
dtconfig.shortdescription: ask before copying images to new film roll folder
dtconfig.longdescription: always ask the user before any image file is copied.

dtconfig.name: show_folder_levels
dtconfig.shortdescription: number of folder levels to show in lists
dtconfig.longdescription: the number of folder levels to show in film roll names, starting from the right

dtconfig.name: config_version
dtconfig.shortdescription: version of these dt-gconf entries
dtconfig.longdescription: if this number is smaller than the darktable internal version number, the values here will be synched with the new defaults.

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/jobcode
dtconfig.shortdescription: name of capture job

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/storage/basedirectory
dtconfig.shortdescription: path of storage for captured images

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/storage/subpath
dtconfig.shortdescription: subpath pattern in storage for captured images

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/storage/namepattern
dtconfig.shortdescription: rename pattern for captured images

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/camera/import/delete_originals
dtconfig.shortdescription: flag if originals on camera should be deleted

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/camera/import/jobcode
dtconfig.shortdescription: jobcode of import job

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/backup/enable
dtconfig.shortdescription: flag if backup of imported images should be performed

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/backup/warn
dtconfig.shortdescription: flag if user should be interactivly warned about non present backup destinations

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/backup/foldername
dtconfig.shortdescription: the name of backup directory to search for on mounted medias

dtconfig.name: ui_last/colorpicker_mean
dtconfig.shortdescription: 0: mean, 1: min, 2: max

dtconfig.name: ui_last/grouping
dtconfig.shortdescription: grouping of images
dtconfig.longdescription: only show a single image for each set of grouped images in lighttable and filmstrip

dtconfig.name: ui_last/import_ignore_jpegs
dtconfig.shortdescription: ignore jpeg images when importing film rolls
dtconfig.longdescription: when having raw+jpeg images together in one directory it makes no sense to import both. with this flag one can ignore all jpegs found.

dtconfig.name: ui_last/import_recursive
dtconfig.shortdescription: recursive directory traversal when importing filmrolls

dtconfig.name: ui_last/import_last_creator
dtconfig.shortdescription: creator to be applied when importing

dtconfig.name: ui_last/import_last_publisher
dtconfig.shortdescription: publisher to be applied when importing

dtconfig.name: ui_last/import_last_rights
dtconfig.shortdescription: rights to be applied when importing

dtconfig.name: ui_last/import_last_tags
dtconfig.shortdescription: comma separated tags to be applied when importing

dtconfig.name: ui_last/import_last_directory
dtconfig.shortdescription: last opened directory.

dtconfig.name: ui_last/import_initial_rating
dtconfig.shortdescription: initial import rating
dtconfig.longdescription: initial star rating for all images when importing a filmroll

dtconfig.name: plugins/capture/mode
dtconfig.shortdescription: capture view mode

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/filmstrip/visible
dtconfig.shortdescription: enable filmstrip
dtconfig.longdescription: enable the filmstrip in darkroom and tethering modes.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/filmstrip/height
dtconfig.shortdescription: height of filmstrip
dtconfig.longdescription: height of the filmstrip in pixels

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/low_quality_thumbnails
dtconfig.shortdescription: low quality thumbnails
dtconfig.longdescription: if set to true, thumbnails will be processed by first downscaling rather than demosaicing the full image. this can result in much faster processing times and blurrier images, especially when you cropped a lot.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/thumbnail_width
dtconfig.shortdescription: maximum width of image drawing area
dtconfig.longdescription: maximum width of the image drawing area in darkroom mode. adjust to your screen\n(needs a restart and will invalidate current thumbnail caches).

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/thumbnail_height
dtconfig.shortdescription: maximum height of image drawing area
dtconfig.longdescription: maximum height of the image drawing area in dakroom mode. adjust to your screen\n(needs a restart and will invalidate current thumbnail caches).

dtconfig.name: cache_compression
dtconfig.shortdescription: compression of thumbnail images
dtconfig.longdescription: off - no compression in memory, jpg on disk. low quality - dxt1 (fast). high quality - dxt1, same memory as low quality variant but slower.

dtconfig.name: database_cache_quality
dtconfig.shortdescription: jpeg quality of on-disk thumbnails
dtconfig.longdescription: affects only the thumbnail cache used for quick startup.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/draw_group_borders
dtconfig.shortdescription: draw borders around grouped images
dtconfig.longdescription: draw borders around grouped images when grouping is turned off and the mouse hovers over one of the images of the group

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/layout
dtconfig.shortdescription: lighttable layout mode
dtconfig.longdescription: select a layout for the lighttable: 0 - zoomable lighttable or 1 - file manager.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/images_in_row
dtconfig.shortdescription: images per row

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/copy_history/pastemode
dtconfig.shortdescription: append or replace history stack if pasted
dtconfig.longdescription: 0 -- append on top of stack, 1 -- replace it.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/tagging/ask_before_delete_tag
dtconfig.shortdescription: ask before deleting a tag

dtconfig.name: plugins/map/max_images_drawn
dtconfig.shortdescription: maximum number of images drawn on map
dtconfig.longdescription: the maximum number of geotagged images drawn on the map. increasing this number can slow drawing of the map down (needs a restart).

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/metadata_view/pretty_location
dtconfig.shortdescription: pretty print the image location
dtconfig.longdescription: show a more readable representation of the location in the image information module

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/export/force_lcms2
dtconfig.shortdescription: always use littlecms2 during export
dtconfig.longdescription: this is about 28x as slow as the default.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/export/high_quality_processing
dtconfig.shortdescription: do high quality resampling during export
dtconfig.longdescription: the image will first be processed in full resolution, and downscaled at the very end. this can result in better quality sometimes, but will always be slower.

dtconfig.name: plugins/darkroom/dithering/dither_center_view
dtconfig.shortdescription: dithering for darkroom mode
dtconfig.longdescription: center view will be dithered if this option is on and module dithering is activated (default for new images). switch this to off if you can accept display banding and prefer to have a slightly faster processing speed.

dtconfig.name: plugins/darkroom/demosaic/quality
dtconfig.shortdescription: demosaicing for zoomed out darkroom mode
dtconfig.longdescription: interpolation when not viewing 1:1 in darkroom mode: bilinear is fastest, but not as sharp. middle ground is using ppg + interpolation modes specified below, full will use exactly the settings for full-size export.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/export/pixel_interpolator
dtconfig.shortdescription: pixel interpolator
dtconfig.longdescription: pixel interpolator used in rotation and lens correction (bilinear, bicubic, lanczos2, lanczos3).

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/export/width
dtconfig.shortdescription: width of the exported image
dtconfig.longdescription: width of the exported image, or 0 if no scaling should be done.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/export/height
dtconfig.shortdescription: height of the exported image
dtconfig.longdescription: height of the exported image, or 0 if no scaling should be done.

dtconfig.name: plugins/imageio/storage/email/client
dtconfig.shortdescription: client to use, this overrides detection of default client.

dtconfig.name: plugins/pwstorage/pwstorage_backend
dtconfig.shortdescription: password storage backend to use
dtconfig.longdescription: the storage backend for password storage: none, kwallet, gnome keyring

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/export/iccprofile
dtconfig.shortdescription: icc profile to use for export
dtconfig.longdescription: this overrides the per-image settings, if not set to `image'.

dtconfig.name: plugins/lighttable/export/iccintent
dtconfig.shortdescription: icc rendering intent
dtconfig.longdescription: if non-negative, this overrides the per-image output color profile rendering intent on export.

dtconfig.name: plugins/darkroom/spots/size
dtconfig.shortdescription: percent of image size

dtconfig.name: plugins/darkroom/clipping/custom_aspect
dtconfig.shortdescription: last chosen custom aspect ratio

dtconfig.name: plugins/darkroom/clipping/aspect_preset
dtconfig.shortdescription: last chosen aspect ratio preset

dtconfig.name: run_similarity_indexer
dtconfig.shortdescription: run indexer
dtconfig.longdescription: index images in background, so you can search them by similarity.
